title: Ontology-based Learning Design Model Development Process

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of Basic Learning Design Theory and Intermediate-Level Domain Expertise
context.additional_context: Strengthening capacity to develop socially contextualized learning content for professionals (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: They can explain learning model design procedures using ontology structures with 80%+ accuracy
Pass three practical evaluations demonstrating learning resource retrieval and reorganization skills in simulation/VR environments

Learners can develop a prototype for an automated social studies content generation tool reflecting disciplinary characteristics (historical context, societal issues, civic competency elements) within 3 weeks and submit verifiable deliverables (code repository link, demo video, test report) meeting ≥2 predefined criteria: functionality (≥70%), usability (≥60%), scalability (≥50%).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
